docs.title: Installing MkDocs Material
docs.text: To install MkDocs Material using Python, you will use pip, Python's package installer. Ensure Python and pip are installed.

docs.title: 1. Verify Python and pip Installation
docs.text:
Before installing MkDocs Material, verify that you have Python and pip installed on your system. You can check their versions with the following commands in your terminal:

python --version
pip --version

If they are not installed, you will need to install Python first, which typically includes pip.

docs.title: 2. Install MkDocs Material
docs.text:
Open your terminal or command prompt and execute the following command:

pip install mkdocs-material

This command will download and install the MkDocs Material theme and its dependencies.

docs.title: 3. Create a New MkDocs Project
docs.text:
If you are starting a new documentation project, create a new MkDocs project with:

mkdocs new my-project
cd my-project

docs.title: 4. Configure the Material Theme
docs.text:
Open the mkdocs.yml file in your project directory and add or modify the theme setting to use Material:

theme:
  name: material

docs.title: 5. Serve Your Documentation
docs.text:
Navigate to your project directory in the terminal and run the MkDocs development server to preview your site with the Material theme:

mkdocs serve

You can then access your documentation in a web browser, typically at:

👉 http://localhost:8000

docs.title: 6. Text commands in markdown
docs.text:
• This is example of italic text

    eg: This is example of _italic text_

  • This is the BOLD text

    eg:This is the **BOLD text** in the IOT sample feature

  • This is the HTML tag example for highlighted text in mkdocs

    eg: <mark>This is the HTML tag example for highlighted text in mkdocs</mark>

  • This one is the example of the striked text via <s> parameter in IOT sample feature

    eg: <s>This one is the example of the striked text via ```<s>``` parameter in IOT sample feature</s>

  • This one is the example of the striked text via <del> parameter in IOT sample feature

    eg: <del>This one is the example of the striked text via ```<del>``` parameter in IOT sample feature</del>

  • This is an example of table :

Test Test Test 123 456 678

eg: |Test|Test|Test| table header

|---|---|---| for new line

|123|456|678| content

docs.title: Feature 2467843 : Enhancement in existing JioBharat & JioPhone Plan delay visibility by 48 hrs.
Akash Rajput
docs.text: S NO Date Version History Version 1. 13 Nov 2025 Initial Draft v0.1

docs.title: Impact EBDM, EDIF
docs.text:
• Put incoming IMEI into 48HOURS list(new),
  • 48HOURS_FLAG = N (new)
  • Sent to EDIF
  • counter starts for 48 Hrs. to update 48HOURS_FLAG
  • Case1 :
  • No letch event received within 48 Hrs. for the same IMEI

  • After 48 Hrs.

    • Update the 48HOURS_FLAG = Y
    • Send it to EDIF
    • Remove entry from 48HOURS list

  • Case2 :

  • Letch event received within 48 Hrs. for the same IMEI

    • IMEI received exists in 48HOURS list
    • Remove the entry from the 48HOURS list
    • Insert the new entry in 48HOURS list
    • After 48 Hrs. (for the new entry, if no further letch event received)
    • Update the 48HOURS_FLAG = Y
    • Send it to EDIF
    • Remove from 48HOURS list

  • In CCI to EDIF :

If 48HOURS_FLAG=Y or 48HOURS_FLAG=NULL

Channel to show the JioBharat/JioPhone plan

otherwise

Channel not to show the JioBharat/JioPhone plan

docs.title: Flowchart
docs.text: ```mermaid graph TD A[Start] --> B{Is it working?}; B -->|Yes| C[Great!]; B -->|No| D[Debug]; D --> B; C --> E[End];
